definition: A button on the home screen that tells you about several points of interest roughly ahead of the direction you are facing—useful for exploring an unfamiliar area
notes: Convey the idea of ‘looking ahead’ and not just ‘forward.’

definition: A home‑screen button that announces one point of interest in each of the four quadrants around you (ahead, right, behind and left) to help orient you
notes: Emphasise ‘surroundings’ and orientation; avoid implying only one direction.

definition: Button that quickly announces where you are, including your facing direction, nearby roads/intersections and points of interest
notes: Make sure the possessive ‘my’ is clear; this is about the user’s current position.

definition: Button that reports up to four saved markers closest to you to help you orient yourself using places you already know

When set on a location, the app plays a continuous audible sound from that direction; the home screen shows the distance and address. It helps you track a destination but does not give turn‑by‑turn directions
notes: ‘Beacon’ may not have a direct equivalent; describe it as a ‘sound beacon’ or ‘audible guide.’

definition: A type of automatic callout describing the layout of intersections as you approach and confirming the road you are on when leaving
In this mode, the app silences all callouts until you ‘wake’ the app again, providing temporary quiet without closing the app
notes: Different from muting a beacon; akin to ‘pause’ mode.

definition: A saved location. Markers can be personal places like home, office or grocery store or custom points not on maps (e.g., building entrances, pedestrian crossings). Soundscape can call them out automatically, and you can set an audio beacon on any marker
notes: Use a term like ‘saved point,’ ‘pin,’ or ‘landmark’; emphasise that markers may not exist on standard maps.

definition: An optional descriptive note attached to a marker that is spoken when the marker is called out
notes: This is additional information, not the marker’s name.

definition: A sequence of waypoints that form a path. Soundscape announces when you reach each waypoint, and the audio beacon automatically switches to the next
notes: This is not turn‑by‑turn navigation; emphasise sequential guidance.

definition: An individual point along a route; you add waypoints when creating a route and receive notifications when arriving at each one
A Home‑screen button listing nearby places you can explore or use when setting a beacon or saving a marker
notes: Should convey ‘nearby places’ or ‘nearby points of interest.’

definition: Input field on the home screen for searching by place name or address
notes: Use the standard term for a search field.

definition: A setting that lets you choose among the text‑to‑speech voices installed on your device. Change the voice via Settings → Voices

When the internet connection is unavailable, Soundscape enters offline mode. The app still works but some functions are limited; callouts and audio beacons work for places stored in your callout history
